intro: Pimpinella brachystyla, commonly known as the short-styled cow-weed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels, and its leaves are pinnately divided with a distinctive, feathery appearance. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Pimpinella brachystyla is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
